adjectives.description: defoliate (comparative more defoliate, superlative most defoliate)

verbs.description: defoliate (third-person singular simple present defoliates, present participle defoliating, simple past and past participle defoliated)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To remove foliage from (one or more plants), most often with a chemical agent.
examples: Agent Orange was used to defoliate jungle vegetation.
